answer: Well, the judge in this case decided to go with what was effectively a Hail Mary path, because Michael Skakel has tried many times to overturn his guilty verdict.

question: I want to just get your reactions to what has happened today with this news that they maybe a new trial?

answer: Well, first of all, there's not a way they can erase what was said during the first trial.

question: Did you, Mrs. Moxley, have never had a shred of doubts in your mind that Michael Skakel was the person who killed your daughter?

answer: You know something, there are wonderful, wonderful people in this world.
question: How have you coped over the years and how do you cope today?

answer: OXLEY: You know because I've had such wonderful people who have helped me.
question: Now what I was asking really Moxley, when was how you personally as Martha's mother have coped with her horrendous death over the last four decades?

answer: Well, you know, one of the most common things that defendants raise after the trial is my lawyer did a bad job.
question: Do you think about the legality of what has happened?

answer: It's going to be very difficult if they have to retrial the case because now there's been yet another 10 years have gone and this has passed away.
question: And given the proximity of time that is four decades after the death of this poor girl, can real justice still be attained after such a long period of time?

answer: I have to tell you.
question: What do you feel about regurgitating all this so long after you've been in relation to her and her family?

answer: Yes.
question: Is this Jeffrey Toobin?

answer: Well, we know now the prosecutors are going to try him as an adult and that's going to be up to the grand jury to come back to decide whether or not they try him as an adult.
question: What do we know about this case?

answer: Yeah.
question: And the only clue at the moment was blood found in an upstairs room and that led them to find her body is that right?

answer: When I had found out that Ms. Ritzer was murdered in the school it was devastating.
question: What was your reaction to the news when you heard what had happened?

answer: Oh, she was so kind.
question: ... Ms. Ritzer?

answer: I think the best thing she has going for her is the fact that Republicans are calling for her head because there's nothing that President Obama dislikes more than Republicans calling for the firing.
question: Can Kathleen Sebelius survive this if it continues to be a mess for weeks, months ahead?

answer: I'll wear it proudly.
question: Do you fear in your darkest moments that when you eventually live this mortal world of Oz that the headline maybe man who kept Dick Cheney alive in decades?

answer: Incredibly courageous.
question: I've never meet Dick Cheney but obviously he's got this very tough reputation, very hard politician in anyway, very divisive, what was he like when he's going through such quite regular life and death scenarios in his own private life?

question: Tell me this, should somebody who is that sick or potentially could be fatally taken anytime, should they be vice president, were you concerned that actually he maybe old to stand out?

answer: You know, I actually didn't see it then I have seen it, but the night that it was broadcast Mrs. Cheney e-mailed me and said, "Oh my God did you see Homeland tonight they just killed the vice president by reprogramming his defibrillator."
question: Did it bring back memories to you a precisely the kind of thing that you feared?

answer: No, not at all.
question: I've also been watching this other show Hostages ago with the similar plot line with the terrorist get to the surgeon was about to operate and were you ever concern that people might try and get to you?

answer: First thing, it was very exciting, I mean it was beautiful over here, the sun was shining and as you said, it was actually a really big day obviously for George but only the second time we've seen him since he emerged from the hospital up to his birth.
question: Katie, what an exciting day, you must have been bursting with excitement?

answer: It was to have, you know, everybody who has gone through rough times and hurdles that they have to jump over to come together and to, you know, just share our message that even though we might have things to jump over, you know, we roar.
question: What was the idea behind this?

answer: We are.
